text: A remake of “Rebecca” could have been fertile terrain on which to explore issues of control, abuse, and the sheer terror of becoming a wife at all. The superficial new Netflix adaptation fails to plumb these possible depths. https://t.co/XaMhLt4WDY

name: NewYorker
text: The tortillas at Yellow Rose, a Texas-themed restaurant in the East Village, left @hannahgoldfield “gobsmacked,” she writes. They were “thick, chewy, a little stretchy, salty, charred, ever so slightly powdery to the touch.” https://t.co/MIoBZ09ADk
